Controller

Class GestureController

  • java.lang.Object
    • Controller.GestureController

  • public class GestureController
extends java.lang.Object
    A class to create and recognize simple gestures using the relationship between two joints provided by SimpleOpenNI. An instance of this class should be used for each individual gesture. Currently does NOT work with multiple users.
    Author:
    Levi Lindsley

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      private class  GestureController.P
      Class to hold various information about joins and relation to each other and the other actions in sequence.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.util.Vector<GestureController.P> con
      A list of constant positions that must be true for the gesture to complete
      private boolean debug
      Used only to toggle debug output
      private java.lang.Integer ep
      Epsilon used to widen zero, modifying this will make zero have a larger range and thus be easier to hit but will decreace the sensitivity of noting when joints are not alligned It may be beneficial to split this into an x,y,z epsilon.
      private java.util.Vector<GestureController.P> seq
      The Sequence if joint relationships describing the gesture
      private java.lang.Integer step
      Number of completed steps of the gesture

      GestureController()
      Default Constructor: Initializes the control arrays and sets step to 0

      • debug

        Used only to toggle debug output

      • seq

      • con

        private java.util.Vector<GestureController.P> con
        A list of constant positions that must be true for the gesture to complete

      • ep

        private java.lang.Integer ep
        Epsilon used to widen zero, modifying this will make zero have a larger range and thus be easier to hit but will decreace the sensitivity of noting when joints are not alligned It may be beneficial to split this into an x,y,z epsilon.

      • step

        private java.lang.Integer step
        Number of completed steps of the gesture

    • Method Detail

      • addPoint

        public void addPoint(int J1,
            int J2,
            java.lang.Integer x,
            java.lang.Integer y,
            java.lang.Integer z,
            boolean conn)
        Adds a joint relationship to the seq array.
        Parameters:
        J1 - : SimpleOpenNI constant for a joint
        J2 - : SimpleOpenNI constant for a joint
        x - : Valid values {-1,0,1}
        y - : Valid values {-1,0,1}
        z - : Valid values {-1,0,1}
        conn - : Determines if this is concurrent with the gesture after it should be false for last gesture

      • addConstant

        public void addConstant(int J1,
               int J2,
               java.lang.Integer x,
               java.lang.Integer y,
               java.lang.Integer z)
        Add a Joint relationship to con vector. The x,y,z points may be null and if they are the null axis will be ignored this is so a constant constraint can use fewer constraint axis if it is suitable for the gesture.
        Parameters:
        J1 - : SimpleOpenNI constant for a joint
        J2 - : SimpleOpenNI constant for a joint
        x - : Valid values {-1,0,1} or null which translates into ignore this axis
        y - : Valid values {-1,0,1} or null which translates into ignore this axis
        z - : Valid values {-1,0,1} or null which translates into ignore this axis

      • isComplete

        public boolean isComplete(SimpleOpenNI.SimpleOpenNI context,
                 int user)
        This function should be called to check for gesture completion and to update the gesture. Checks if the gesture designated is complete or not. If it is not complete then the skeletal model from context is checked against a the current step of the gesture if the skeletal model matches then the step is incremented. If the retrieved skeletal position is between the current point and the previous competed point for the joint pair then the gesture is incremented or reset it hits a 'holding pattern' waiting for success or failure. If the gesture does not match either of the previous two conditions then it is assumed that the gesture failed and is reset accordingly.
        Parameters:
        context - : A SimpleOpenNI instance
        user - : Id for users to check skeleton
        Returns:
        True if gesture is compete. Gesture is reset if complete. Gesture is incremented if not complete.

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Manually restart the gesture may be useful to impose other restrictions on the gesture that the controller does not account for such as being within a bounding box or holding an object

      • comp

        private int comp(float x,
       float x2)
        Compares to floating point values taking ep (Epsilon) into account for equality. Returns the relationship proper between x and x2 (x {=, <, >} x2). This function may be modified to get range relation instead of relationship.
        Parameters:
        x - : A floating point value to be compared
        x2 - : A floating point value to compare aginst
        Returns:
        0 : values were within the range given by ep 1 : x > (x2+ep) -1 : x < (x2-ep)

      • constMatch

        private boolean constMatch(GestureController.P c,
                 SimpleOpenNI.SimpleOpenNI context,
                 int user)
        Determines if a skeletal model taken from context matches a constant relation given by c.
        Parameters:
        c - : A constant joint relationship should be from con vector
        context - : SimpleOpenNI instance
        user - : Id of user to get skeleton from context
        Returns:
        True if the relation ship matches given relationship from c

      • stepMatch

        private boolean stepMatch(int x,
                int y,
                int z)
        Check if the current step matches the relationship given by x,y,z perfectly
        Parameters:
        x - : The x axis relationship of the joints
        y - : The y axis relationship of the joints
        z - : The z axis relationship of the joints
        Returns:
        True if the x,y,z all match the respecive relationship given by the current step in the sequence

      • midMatch

        private boolean midMatch(int x,
               int y,
               int z)
        Checks to see if the given x,y,z relationships fall between the relationships given by the current step and the previous step. This is used to check if a gesture may have paused but not terminated such as the user is moving slow so they haven't made it to the next step but did not do anything wrong yet the controller just needs to wait on the user to finish the gesture.
        Parameters:
        x - : The x axis relationship of the joints
        y - : The y axis relationship of the joints
        z - : The z axis relationship of the joints
        Returns:
        True if the given relationships fall between the current and previous step.

      • chkCoord

        private boolean chkCoord(int cur,
               int val,
               int prev)
        Checks if val is between cur and prev, the bounds do not need to be in any order thus if prev > cur, cur > prev, or cur = prev this will still return the proper value
        Parameters:
        cur - : bounding value
        val - : value to check
        prev - : bounding value
        Returns:
        True if val is between cur and prev

      • next

        private java.lang.Boolean next(SimpleOpenNI.SimpleOpenNI context,
                     int user)
        Checks the next step to see if the skeletal model derived from context matches the expected values and increments step accordingly
        Parameters:
        context - : SimpleOpenNI instance
        user - : Id of user to get skeletal model data from
        Returns:
        True if the gesture step completed and step was incremented False if the gesture failed and step was reset null if the gesture hit a holding pattern and step did not change
